div.l: He saide what amounteth alle þis wytte
What schall we speke al daye of holy wrytte
The deuell made a Reve for to precche
Or of a sowter schipman or a leche
Seye forth þi tale and tarye not þe tyme
Loo depforth and it is halfe weye pryme
Loo grenwyche þat mony a schrewe is Inne
It wer͗e al tyme þi tale for to gynne
Nowe sirres qduod þis Ossewald þe Reue
I pray ȝowe alle þat ȝe take it not to greue
Þogh I answer͗e ande somdel sette his houwe
For leuefull is with force force to shouwe
This dronken̄ Meller͗e hath y told us here
Howe þat begiled was a carpenter͗e
ꝐPar auentur͗e in skorne for I am oone
And by ȝour͗e leue I schall hym quyte a noon̄
Riȝt in his cherlis termes will I speke
I pray to god his nekke mot to breke
He can well in myn̄ eye seen̄ a stalke
But in his owene he can̄ not sene a balke
¶ Hic incipit fabula
Atte Trumpyngton̄ noȝht ferr͗e from Cantirbrigge
Ther goth a broke and ouer þat a brygge
Opon þe whiche brooke þer stant a melle
And þis a verrey sothe þat I ȝowe telle
A Meller͗e was þer dwellynge many a daye
As eny pecoke he was proude and gaye
Pypen̄ he couthe and fysshen̄ and nettes bete
And turne coppes ande wele wrastell ande schete
Ay by his belte he bar͗e a longe panade
And of a swerde full trenchant was þe blade
A Ioly popper bar͗e he in his pouche
Ther was no man̄ for p̉erill durste hym touche
A Sheffeld twhytell bar͗e he in his hose
Rounde was his face and camuse was his noose
As pilled as an ape was his sculle
He was a market beter at þe full
Ther was no wyȝht þat dorste hande on hym legge
But if he swor͗e he schuld onon̄ a begge
A thefe he was forsothe of corne and meele
And þat a sleygh and vsaunte for to steele
His name was hoten̄ deynous symkyn̄
A wyffe he hadde comen̄ of noble kynne
The ꝑperson of þe town̄ hir͗e fader was
With hir͗e he ȝaff full mony a pan̄ of brasse
For þat symkyn̄ schuld in his blode alye
